MMfem documentation

Welcome to MMfem, a Python package for modeling and solving the Navier-Stokes problem using finite elements. This package is focused on academic research and reproducible numerical experimentation.

MMfem is based on NGSolve, prioritizing clarity, extensibility, and mathematical transparency over black-box solvers.

The package is intended for:

  • research in numerical analysis and scientific computing

  • prototyping finite element methods

  • teaching and academic experimentation

Installation

MMfem is developed as a standard Python package using the src layout. The recommended installation method is an editable install.

Requirements

  • Python ≥ 3.9

  • NGSolve (installed via conda)

  • NumPy

Using conda (recommended)

First, activate your conda environment where NGSolve is installed:

conda activate base

(or any environment where ngsolve is available)

Then, from the root of the repository:

pip install -e .

This allows you to modify the source code without reinstalling the package.

Verify installation

You can verify the installation by running:

python -c "import mmfem; print(mmfem.__version__)"

Getting started

A simple example to generate a rectangular mesh:

from mmfem.mesh import rectangle_mesh

mesh = rectangle_mesh(
    x_min=0.0,
    x_max=1.0,
    y_min=0.0,
    y_max=1.0,
    h=0.1
)

The complete API documentation is available below.
